title: Canonical 3+1 Description of Relativistic Membranes
abstract: $M$-dimensional extended objects $\Sigma$ can be described by projecting a Diff $\Sigma$ invariant Hamiltonian of time-independent Hamiltonian density {\cal H} onto the Diff $\Sigma$- singlet sector, which after Hamiltonian reduction, using {\cal H} itself for one of the gauge-fixing conditions, results in a non-local description that may enable one to extend the non-local symmetries for strings to higher dimensions and make contact with gravity at an early stage.
